intro: Parrya khorasanica, commonly known as the Khorasan parrya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white flowers bloom in late spring. Parrya khorasanica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
